text: Fürth's Rathaus - the gate at the front corner is the entrance to the Crime Museum The Fürth Crime Museum (German - Kriminalmuseum Fürth) is a museum on crime and policing in the city of Fürth in Bavaria, Germany since the 19th century, starting with the establishment of the commission on policing and justice by Karl August von Hardenberg and the police of the Kingdom of Bavaria. It opened on 22 September 2010 in the former courtroom of the town's Rathaus or town hall. ==References== category:Law enforcement museums in Germany category:Museums in Bavaria category:2010 establishments in Germany category:Buildings and structures in Fürth
title: Fürth Crime Museum
